result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin James Jemison Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 8/26/14. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge by 8/26/14; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvin James Jemison Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing. Parties are ready to proceed.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen on behalf of Joshua Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Defense counsel has received an offer and discovery from the State. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. ADA Mathy is now assigned to this case. Defense counsel requests additional time to review case with the State and obtain an offer. All bail conditions remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice Point report received and filed and reviewed by all parties.  Request for short status date, granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul Tiffin for Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dugan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/19/14.
css

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor as a friend of the Court.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant may qualify for State Public Defender representation at this time, due to employment status.  Court grants a brief adjournment.  Case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/12/14.
css
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Alvin James Jemison in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Alvin James Jemison in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL IF HE REMAINS IN CUSTODY.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
